intro: Siphocampylus venosus var. neivanus, commonly known as the Neivan's siphocampylus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, humid environments and is often found in high-altitude grasslands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
